Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.

body.name: Front and Rear ABS Sensor Air Gap Measurement

body.body: Rotate the wheel and repeat the measurement in several places to ensure the ABS pulser ring is not distorted or bent. Renew a damaged ABS pulser ring.
Adjust the air gap using the correct shim(s) to achieve an air gap between 0.1 - 1.5 mm.
Shims are available in the following sizes: 0.5 mm, 1.0 mm, 1.5 mm and 2.0 mm.
Do not install more than two shims. If the required air gap cannot be achieved using two shims, investigate and rectify the cause before proceeding.
If necessary, remove the wheel speed sensor, fit the correct thickness shim(s) and refit the wheel speed sensor.
